snippet: The bill, which is supported by Gov. Dannel P. Malloy, is expected to pass the House of Representatives, which would make Connecticut the 17th state without a death penalty.
abstract: Connecticut State Senate votes, 20-16, to abolish the death penalty, moving toward a national trend away from capital punishment; Democratic-controlled House of Representatives is expected to approve the bill, making Connecticut the 17th state without a death penalty.
lead_paragraph: The bill, which is supported by Gov. Dannel P. Malloy, is expected to pass the House of Representatives, which would make Connecticut the 17th state without a death penalty.

headline.seo: Death Penalty Repeal Bill Passes Connecticut Senate
headline.main: With Senate Vote, Connecticut Is on Track to End Capital Punishment
headline.print_headline: With Senate Vote, Connecticut Is on Track to End Capital Punishment
